name: Canadian Museum for Human Rights
excerpt: Housed in a stunning contemporary building designed by American architect Antoine Predock, this terrific museum explores human rights issues as they…
detail_description:
Housed in a stunning contemporary building designed by American architect Antoine Predock, this terrific museum explores human rights issues as they relate to Canada, its culture and the rest of the world through striking interactive displays, videos, art and more. Exhibits don't shy away from sensitive subjects, such as the internment of Canadian-Japanese people during WWII and Indigenous children forced into residential schools as recently as the 1990s, and the Holocaust and Holodomor (Ukrainian famine of 1932–33) are treated sensitively.
On a high-profile site near Provencher Bridge, this is the first national museum outside of Ottawa. Symbolism abounds, with an enormous glass cloud wrapping around the northern facade, modeled in the image of five dove wings wrapping one over the other. Head up the Israel Asper Tower of Hope in the elevator for an excellent view of Winnipeg. New exhibits cover the plight of the Rohingya in Myanmar and the disproportionate mortality by homicide of First Nations and Inuit women.

name: Aceartinc
excerpt: This gallery stages changing exhibitions of contemporary art by local artists.
detail_description: This gallery stages changing exhibitions of contemporary art by local artists.

name: Cube
excerpt: Hypermodernist stage for live performances that looks remarkably like a Borg cube from Star Trek.

excerpt: Contemporary art rules at this gallery, with changing exhibitions from local and international artists.

name: Urban Shaman Contemporary Aboriginal Art
excerpt: Artist-run gallery displaying contemporary Canadian First Nations art, from Cree and Ojibway paintings to installations.
detail_description: Artist-run gallery displaying contemporary Canadian First Nations art, from Cree and Ojibway paintings to installations.

name: Ross House Museum
excerpt: The small log cabin where William Ross ran the west's first post office is in a pretty setting and documents pioneer life in the 1850s.
detail_description: The small log cabin where William Ross ran the west's first post office is in a pretty setting and documents pioneer life in the 1850s.

name: Tinkertown Family Fun Park
excerpt: For old-fashioned thrills, Tinkertown Family Fun Park has rides and games in a carnival setting. Play mini-golf and then have a miniature doughnut.
detail_description: For old-fashioned thrills, Tinkertown Family Fun Park has rides and games in a carnival setting. Play mini-golf and then have a miniature doughnut.

name: Graffiti Gallery
excerpt: Aims to redirect young artists away from vandalism toward the creation of sanctioned public art, and stages exhibitions ranging from sculpture and…
detail_description: Aims to redirect young artists away from vandalism toward the creation of sanctioned public art, and stages exhibitions ranging from sculpture and graffiti to live performance and music.

name: Manitoba Children's Museum
excerpt: Kids learn by doing at Manitoba Children's Museum, where 'hands off' is not part of the program. The colorful, high-tech, interactive exhibits encourage…
detail_description: Kids learn by doing at Manitoba Children's Museum, where 'hands off' is not part of the program. The colorful, high-tech, interactive exhibits encourage tykes to act as train conductors, astronauts and TV producers.

name: Royal Canadian Mint
excerpt: Producing loonies to the tune of billions of dollars, this high-tech mint produces money for Canada and 60 other nations. Tour the pyramid-shaped glass…
detail_description: Producing loonies to the tune of billions of dollars, this high-tech mint produces money for Canada and 60 other nations. Tour the pyramid-shaped glass facility to see how money is made. It lies 9km southeast of the city center.

name: Fort Gibraltar
excerpt: Behind wooden walls sits this recreated fur-trade fort. Along with inspired interpreters, the genuine clothes, tools, furs, bunks, and bannock and…
detail_description: Behind wooden walls sits this recreated fur-trade fort. Along with inspired interpreters, the genuine clothes, tools, furs, bunks, and bannock and blacksmith shops give a sense of 1810-era life at the Forks, the fort's original location.
